pull.title: Build: remove non-distribution files/directories during make distclean.
pull.body: Addresses #13433 and includes a few other items `make distclean` currently misses (share/rpcauth/\_\_pycache\_\_, src/test/\*.cpp.log and src/wallet/test/\*.cpp.log).

events.body: Just noting that the changes would have to be submitted to upstream leveldb and univalue.

Yep, @murrayn can you remove the [secp256k1](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1) and [univalue](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/univalue) changes from this PR, and send them upstream. The tests wont run here with any subtree changes.
@murrayn Is it possible to add these in terms of existing variables so that it doesn't go stale?

events.message: Undo distclean changes to secp256k1 and univalue; move them to Makefile.am

events.body: @theuni I don't see any existing variables to use. Do you have any suggestions?

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 50 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
Going to close this as it seems most of the files missed by distclean are from autogen.sh and configure, so any fixes would be better applied to them specifically.
